words.ENTRY: <H>mad</H><audio>mad.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS>(<DR>madder</DR>; <DR>maddest</DR>) <CF>mad (at somebody)</CF> <D>very angry:</D> <X>His laziness really makes me mad!</X><dot><X>Don't get mad at him. He didn't mean to do it.</X>

makeverb(past, past participle made) 1.to produce something or to cause something to appear: I'll make some coffee.They make VW cars in Germany.What's that shirt made of?2.(used with nouns) to perform a certain action: to make a mistake/a noise/a statement/a suggestionto make progress3.to cause a particular action, feeling or situation: The movie made me cry.That dress makes you look thin.Flying makes him nervous.4.(used with money and numbers): He makes $40,000 a year.
(= earns)to make a lot of money

man1noun(plural men) 1.countablean adult male person: a handsome man in his mid-twentiesmen, women, and children2.countablea person of either sex, male or female: All men are equal.No man could survive long in such conditions.3.(slang) (used when you are talking to somebody): Hey, man, can you lend me a quarter?man2interjection(informal) (used when you are annoyed or surprised): Oh, man! Why does this always happen to me?Man! That's a great car!

<H>manager</H><audio>manager.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a man or woman who controls an organization or part of an organization:</D> <X>Martha is the new manager of the bookstore.</X><dot><X>a sales manager</X>
mangonouncountable (plural mangoes or mangos) a tropical fruit that has yellowish-red skin and is orange inside

manydeterminer; pronoun(used with plural nouns or verbs) 1.a large number of people or things: Many people do not get enough to eat.There are too many mistakes in this essay.Many of the people at the meeting left early.2.(used with how to ask about the number of people or things): How many kids do you have?How many mistakes did you make?How many came to the meeting?

<H>market</H><audio>market.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a place where people go to buy and sell things:</D> <X>The farmers are taking their cattle to the livestock market today.</X><dot><X>an open-air/covered market</X><dot><X>a market square</X>

<H>martial art</H><audio>martial_art.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>usually plural</bracket><D>a type of fighting sport, originally from Asia, in which you usually use your hands and feet as weapons:</D> <X>Karate, judo, and tae kwon do are martial arts.</X>

<H>match</H><audio>match.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to find somebody/something that is like or suitable for somebody/something else or corresponds to something else:</D> <X>The agency tries to match single people with suitable partners.</X><dot><X>Match the words to the corresponding pictures.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>to have the same color or pattern as something else, or to look nice with something else:</D> <X>That blouse doesn't match your skirt.</X><dot><X>We've chosen the curtains, but now we need a carpet to match.</X>

<H>maybe</H><audio>maybe.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>perhaps; possibly:</D> <X>"Are you going to come?" "Maybe."</X><dot><X>There were three, maybe four people there.</X><dot><X>Maybe I'll go to the party and maybe I won't.</X>
mepronoun(used as an object or after the verb be) the person who is speaking or writing: He called me yesterday.She wrote to me last week."Somebody spilled the coffee." "Sorry, it was me."

<H>meal</H><audio>meal.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a certain time when you eat or the food that is eaten at that time:</D> <X>Do you have your main meal at lunchtime or in the evening?</X><dot><X>a heavy/light meal</X>
<H>meat</H><audio>meat.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the flesh of animals or birds that people eat:</D> <X>She doesn't eat meat; she's a vegetarian.</X>

<H>medical</H><audio>medical.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>connected with medicine and the treatment or prevention of illness:</D> <X>a medical school/student</X><dot><X>Have you had any medical treatment during the last three years?</X><dot><X>medical research</X>

meetverb(past, past participle met) 1.to come together by chance or because you have arranged it: You'll never guess who I met today!What time should we meet for lunch?2.to see and know somebody for the first time: Have you two met before?Where did you first meet your husband?3.to go to a place and wait for somebody/something to arrive: I'll come and meet you at the bus station.A limousine will meet your plane and take you to your hotel.

<H>member</H><audio>member.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person, animal or thing that belongs to a group, club, organization, etc.:</D> <X>All the members of the family were there.</X><dot><X>a staff member</X>

<H>message</H><audio>message.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a written or spoken piece of information that is passed from one person to another:</D> <X>Mr. Thomas is not here right now. Can I take a message?</X><dot><X>to get/receive a message from somebody</X><dot><X>Please leave a message after the beep.</X>

mightmodal verb(negative might not) (used for saying that something is possible): "Where's William?" "He might be upstairs."We might be going to Spain on vacation this year.She might not come if she's very busy.
<H>mine</H><audio>mine.mp3</audio><PS>pronoun</PS><D>of or belonging to me:</D> <X>"Whose jacket is this?" "It's mine."</X><dot><X>Don't take your car. You can come in mine.</X>

<H>minute</H><audio>minute.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a period of 60 seconds; one of the 60 parts that make up one hour:</D> <X>It's five minutes to/after nine.</X><dot><X>He called ten minutes ago.</X><dot><X>Hurry up! The plane leaves in twenty minutes!</X><dot><X>The show lasts for about 50 minutes.</X>

<H>miss</H><audio>miss.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to arrive too late for something or to fail to be at something:</D> <X>Hurry up or you'll miss the bus!</X><dot><X>She'll be really upset if you miss her birthday party.</X>

<H>model</H><audio>model.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person whose job is to wear clothes at a fashion show or for magazine photographs:</D> <X>a male fashion model</X><dot><X>Naomi Campbell is a top model.</X>

<H>Monday</H><audio>Monday.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday:</D> <X>I'm going to see her (on) Monday.</X><dot><X>We usually play tennis on Mondays.</X><dot><X>They have piano lessons every Monday.</X><dot><X>Monday morning/afternoon/evening/night</X><dot><X>last/next Monday</X><dot><X>The museum is open Monday through Friday, 10:00 to 4:30.</X>

<H>money</H><audio>money.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the means of paying for something or buying something, especially in the form of coins or bills:</D> <X>How much money do you earn a year?</X><dot><X>Teenagers spend a lot of money on clothes.</X><dot><X>to borrow/lend money </X><CF>make money</CF> <D>to earn money or to make a profit on a business</D>

more1determiner; pronouna larger number of people/
things or larger amount of something; something in addition to what you already have: There were more people than I expected.There's enough room for three more people.Tell me more about your job.more2adverb1.(used to form the comparative of adjectives and adverbs with two or more syllables): He was more frightened than I was.Please write more carefully.2.to a greater extent:
I like him more than I like his wife.This one costs more.

<H>morning</H><audio>morning.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>the early part of the day between the time when the sun rises and noon:</D> <X>Pat's going to Chicago tomorrow morning.</X><dot><X>Dave makes breakfast every morning.</X><dot><X>She only works in the mornings.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>the part of the night that is after midnight:</D> <X>3:00 in the morning </X><CF>good morning</CF> <D>(used when you see somebody for the first time in the morning)</D> <CF>in the morning</CF><NR>1.</NR><D>during the morning of the next day; tomorrow morning:</D> <X>I'll try to talk to her about it in the morning.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>not in the afternoon or evening:</D> <X>He left about 10:30 in the morning.</X>

<H>mostly</H><audio>mostly.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>almost all:</D> <X>The people at work are mostly very nice.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>usually:</D> <X>We mostly go shopping in Vancouver, not Seattle.</X>

<H>mother</H><audio>mother.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>the female parent of a person or an animal:</D> <X>My mother and my father got married in 1980.</X><dot><X>a mother cow and her calf</X>

<H>mountain</H><audio>mountain.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a very high hill:</D> <X>What's the name of the highest mountain in the world?</X><dot><X>Have you ever climbed a mountain?</X><dot><X>a range of mountains</X>
<H>move</H><audio>move.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to go and live in another house, etc.:</D> <X>Our neighbors have sold their house and are moving to Chicago next week.</X>

<H>movie</H><audio>movie.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a story, play, etc. shown in moving pictures in a theater or on television:</D> <X>Would you like to go and see a movie?</X><dot><X>We stayed home last night and watched a movie on TV.</X><dot><X>a science fiction movie</X><dot><X>My favorite movie is "E.T."</X><NR>2.</NR><CF>the movies</CF> <bracket>plural</bracket><D>a building where movies are shown; movie theater:</D> <X>Let's go to the movies.</X>
<H>movie theater</H><audio>movie_theater.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a building where you go to see movies</D>

much1determiner; pronoun(used with uncountable nouns, mainly in negative sentences and questions, or after as, how, so, too) a large amount of something: I don't have much money.Did you have much difficulty finding the house?How much time do you have?I didn't write much.How much do you want?Eat as much as you can.much2adverbto a great extent or degree: I don't like her very much.Thank you very much for a wonderful weekend.Their house is much nicer than ours.You ate much more than I did.

<H>museum</H><audio>museum.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a building where collections of valuable and interesting objects are kept and shown to the public:</D> <X>Have you been to the Science Museum in St. Paul?</X>

<H>mushroom</H><audio>mushroom.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a type of plant (a fungus) which grows very quickly, has a flat rounded top on a short stem and can be eaten as a vegetable:</D> <X>mushrooms with garlic</X><dot><X>mushroom soup</X>

<H>music</H><audio>music.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>an arrangement of sounds in patterns to be sung or played on instruments:</D> <X>What sort of music do you like?</X><dot><X>classical/folk/pop/rock music</X><dot><X>Who composed this piece of music?</X><dot><X>a music lesson</X>
<H>musical</H><audio>musical.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a play or movie which has singing and dancing in it:</D> <X>a Broadway musical</X>
<H>my</H><audio>my.mp3</audio><PS>determiner</PS><D>of or belonging to me:</D> <X>This is my husband, Jim.</X><dot><X>It's my turn, not yours!</X><dot><X>My favorite color is blue.</X>
